prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the rotor dataset._x000d__x000d_
_x000d__x000d_
- Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/rotor.vti_x000d__x000d_
- Set the active scalar array to "Pressure"._x000d__x000d_
- Apply a slice along the Y axis at 95% depth of the dataset (convert percentage to slice index)._x000d__x000d_
- Use a blue → white → red color map for pressure values, spanning from the minimum to maximum scalar range._x000d__x000d_
- Set opacity to fully opaque (no transparency variation)._x000d__x000d_
- Add an orientation marker with XYZ axes in the bottom-right corner._x000d__x000d_
- No interactive GUI controls are required._x000d__x000d_
ground_truth:
_x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ Rotor Dataset Cutting Rendering_x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_
_x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_ _x000d__x000d_
generator_prompt:
You are a VTK.js visualization expert. Based on the user's requirements and the provided VTK.js examples, generate complete and functional HTML code that meets all specified requirements.
    Please follow these guidelines:
    1. Generate complete HTML code that can run independently
    2. Use the VTK.js library from CDN (https://unpkg.com/vtk.js@34.10.0/vtk.js)
    3. Implement ALL requirements specified in the user question
    4. Add detailed comments explaining how each requirement is implemented
    5. Ensure the visualization is displayed properly without UI controls unless specifically requested
    6. Pay special attention to data loading paths and visualization parameters
    7. The data format for generating code is vti format, please use the correct IO module,The system reading method does not support HttpDatasetReader. Please use another appropriate module, such as vtkXMLImageDataReader
    Important: Highlight in comments how each specific user requirement is addressed in the code.
final_prompt:
Generate only the HTML code without any additional text.

evaluator_prompt:
# Role

You are an expert Evaluator for vtk.js and web-based scientific visualization. Your task is to compare the [GENERATED_CODE] against the [GROUND_TRUTH] and evaluate it based on specific dimensions.

# Input Data

## Ground Truth Code:

[GROUND_TRUTH]

## Generated Code:

[GENERATED_CODE]

# Evaluation Criteria & Rubric (0.0 to 1.0)

Please evaluate the generated code based on the following 3 dimensions. 

1. **Functionality & Completeness (Task Completion)**: 
   - Does the code implement the same visualization pipeline as the ground truth? (e.g., correct readers, mappers, filters).
   - Are critical elements present (e.g., color transfer functions, full-screen rendering)?
   - Score 1.0 if logic is identical; lower if steps are missing.

2. **Visual Fidelity (Visual Quality)**:
   - Based on the code logic, will the visual output look similar to the ground truth?
   - Check camera parameters, background colors, and opacity transfer functions.
   - Check if the correct data arrays (scalars/vectors) are selected for coloring.

3. **Code Quality & Maintainability**:
   - Is the code readable, well-structured, and using vtk.js best practices?
   - Is the variable naming clear?

# Response Format

You must output the evaluation in the following Strict XML format. Do not use Markdown block quotes.

<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>[AVERAGE_SCORE]</OverallScore>
        <Critique>[ONE_SENTENCE_SUMMARY]</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

evaluator_evaluation.evaluator_evaluation:
<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>0.85</Score>
        <Reason>The generated code implements a similar visualization pipeline but uses vtkImageSliceFilter instead of direct vtkImageMapper slicing, and omits explicit opacity transfer function setup which affects completeness.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>0.9</Score>
        <Reason>Visual output will be very similar: same slice position (Y=95%), color map (blue-white-red), and axes widget. Background color differs (dark vs white) but doesn't affect core data visualization fidelity.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>0.95</Score>
        <Reason>Generated code is well-structured, uses clear variable names, modular imports, error handling, and follows modern vtk.js practices with descriptive comments.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>0.9</OverallScore>
        <Critique>The generated code is a high-quality, visually faithful implementation with minor functional deviations from the ground truth, particularly in opacity handling and background color.</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

CodeQuality.reason: Generated code is well-structured, uses clear variable names, modular imports, error handling, and follows modern vtk.js practices with descriptive comments.

prompt:
Generate an HTML page using vtk.js to visualize the Deepwater dataset with isosurface rendering._x000d__x000d_
_x000d__x000d_
Load the dataset from: http://127.0.0.1:5000/dataset/deepwater.vti_x000d__x000d_
_x000d__x000d_
Compute velocity magnitude from arrays v02 and v03; if not available, use prs as the scalar_x000d__x000d_
_x000d__x000d_
Generate an isosurface at the mid-value of the scalar range_x000d__x000d_
_x000d__x000d_
Use a blue → white → red color map spanning the scalar range (min to max)_x000d__x000d_
_x000d__x000d_
Set the isosurface to fully opaque with smooth shading_x000d__x000d_
_x000d__x000d_
Add an XYZ orientation marker in the bottom-right corner

evaluator_evaluation.evaluator_evaluation:
<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>0.9</Score>
        <Reason>The generated code implements the core visualization pipeline correctly (reader, contouring, coloring, axes widget), but uses vtkContourFilter instead of vtkImageMarchingCubes and vtkAnnotatedCubeActor instead of vtkAxesActor, which are functionally similar but not identical.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>0.85</Score>
        <Reason>Visual output will be largely similar, but color transfer function has fewer control points (3 vs 5), lighting properties differ (Phong interpolation vs ambient/diffuse/specular), and annotated cube vs simple axes may look different.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>0.95</Score>
        <Reason>Generated code is well-structured, uses modern ES6 modules, includes resize handling, and has clear variable names. It follows vtk.js best practices with proper view setup and modular organization.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>0.9</OverallScore>
        <Critique>The generated code is a high-quality, maintainable implementation that achieves similar visual results with minor functional and aesthetic differences from the ground truth.</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

VisualQuality.reason: Visual output will be largely similar, but color transfer function has fewer control points (3 vs 5), lighting properties differ (Phong interpolation vs ambient/diffuse/specular), and annotated cube vs simple axes may look different.

CodeQuality.reason: Generated code is well-structured, uses modern ES6 modules, includes resize handling, and has clear variable names. It follows vtk.js best practices with proper view setup and modular organization.

        <Critique>The generated code is cleanly implemented but solves a completely different visualization task (streamlines vs. isosurface), resulting in functional and visual mismatch despite good code quality.</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

Please evaluate the generated code based on the following 3 dimensions. 

1. **Functionality & Completeness (Task Completion)**: 
   - Does the code implement the same visualization pipeline as the ground truth? (e.g., correct readers, mappers, filters).
   - Are critical elements present (e.g., color transfer functions, full-screen rendering)?
   - Score 1.0 if logic is identical; lower if steps are missing.

2. **Visual Fidelity (Visual Quality)**:
   - Based on the code logic, will the visual output look similar to the ground truth?
   - Check camera parameters, background colors, and opacity transfer functions.
   - Check if the correct data arrays (scalars/vectors) are selected for coloring.

3. **Code Quality & Maintainability**:
   - Is the code readable, well-structured, and using vtk.js best practices?
   - Is the variable naming clear?

# Response Format

You must output the evaluation in the following Strict XML format. Do not use Markdown block quotes.

<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>[SCORE_FLOAT]</Score>
        <Reason>[BRIEF_REASONING]</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>[AVERAGE_SCORE]</OverallScore>
        <Critique>[ONE_SENTENCE_SUMMARY]</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>

evaluator_evaluation.evaluator_evaluation:
<Evaluation>
    <Dimension name="Functionality">
        <Score>0.85</Score>
        <Reason>The generated code implements the core visualization pipeline correctly (reader, mapper, actor, color/opacity functions) and computes velocity magnitude. However, it omits key settings like sample distance, maximum samples per ray, scalar opacity unit distance, and LAO properties present in the ground truth.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="VisualQuality">
        <Score>0.75</Score>
        <Reason>Visual output will differ due to different shading settings (shading is enabled vs disabled), different camera position (Z-100 vs Z+10), and slightly different opacity curve. Background color is black instead of white, further reducing fidelity.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Dimension name="CodeQuality">
        <Score>0.95</Score>
        <Reason>Generated code is well-structured, uses modern ES6 module syntax, has clear variable names, error handling, and logical flow. Slightly more maintainable than the ground truth despite minor functional omissions.</Reason>
    </Dimension>
    <Summary>
        <OverallScore>0.85</OverallScore>
        <Critique>The generated code is architecturally sound and readable but deviates visually and functionally by omitting advanced rendering parameters and using different shading/camera settings.</Critique>
    </Summary>
</Evaluation>
